alert.note: Alert for Grant (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 21 at 10:05PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest New Mexico, including the following county, Grant. * WHEN...Until midnight MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1005 PM MDT, Doppler radar and Silver City webcam indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Silver City is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall of up to 1 inch is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Silver City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
